revised_title: An Examination into the Structure of the Cells of the Human Lungs and Their Role in Respiration
tldr: Sir Everard Home examines the structure of human lung cells and their role in respiration. He investigates the circulation of blood through the lungs using microscopes and injections, discovering that the structure of the air-cells is better suited for receiving supplies from the atmosphere and transmitting them to the heart. This challenges the existing theory that respiration simply decarbonates the blood.
